thread.title: Kathmandu loses top executive

title: Kathmandu loses top executive
text:
Mon, Aug 10, 2015, 1:20 PM AEST - Australia Markets close in 2 hrs 40 mins Kathmandu loses top executive AAP – 1 hour 4 minutes ago Recommend Print 
The sudden resignation of a Kathmandu executive has nothing to do with Briscoe's takeover offer, the outdoor clothing chain says. 
Chief operating officer Mark Todd will step down at the end of August, ending seven years with the retailer which included a recent stint as interim chief executive before the selection of current boss Xavier Simonet. 
Mr Todd said his decision was made regardless of the outcome of a takeover bid by New Zealand home and sporting goods retailer Briscoe. 
"I had contracted to stay with Kathmandu in my current role until July next year, but now with Xavier on board I feel it is the right time to step aside entirely," he said. 
Kathmandu's board has advised shareholders to reject Briscoe's cash-and-scrip offer of about $A318 million on the grounds it undervalues the company. 
Briscoe's offer will remain open until September 17. 
Mr Todd said he was confident Kathmandu's board has the ability to deliver on the group's forecast of improved sales and earnings in the current financial year.
